page.title: 13The Old School House.
page.content: On the south edge of the village of Edingale is an old, recently restored building known as the Old School House. Attached to the house is a Victorian school which was in use until 1916. The School House is a much older construction and demonstrates many original features. It is thought to be one of the oldest houses in South-East Staffordshire probably dating from around 1480. It is built in a style rare to Staffordshire but common in Warwickshire. Originally it consisted of a main Hall, open to the roof, with a mullioned window, and a Cross-wing which was divided into two storeys. It would have been the home of a wealthy, yeoman farmer and his household. The farmer and his family would have lived in the front parlour of the cross-wing where the ceiling beams are of better quality wood.
